item.title: Perfection is an act of cowardice
item.description:
I‚Äôve been following Van Neistat‚Äôs videos since his fifth video was published, which the YouTube algorithm suggested while I was vanning through Walla Walla, Washington. I was killing time hanging out by the river and, having watched most of his brother Casey‚Äôs daily vlogs (rip daily vlogs), quickly watched all his videos beginning to end.

He can get ranty. He can be cranky. He has plenty of opinions I don‚Äôt agree with. But his videos about the creative process are fascinating.

His latest, about the struggles of perfectionism as a creative person and working toward ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù or ‚Äúexcellent,‚Äù is so relatable:

I usually operate in the ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù camp (ESPECIALLY blogging) with regular forays into attempting excellence (usually for work).

item.title: About
item.description:
About Me

Hi there! üëã

Hi, I‚Äôm Isak - a Minnesota-based writer interested in climate, decarbonization, and wild places.

This is my blog where I show my work, learn in public, and write for fun. It’s intentionally broad. I write about creativity, the outdoors, climate, reading ‚Äî‚Äî things I’m curious bout. Maybe you’ll find something interesting, too.

If you’d like to know more about me professionally, head to my main site.
